The controller can control the Y1 and Y2: The controller can control the Y1 and Y2 axes (Y1 controls the left cylinder and Y2 controls the right cylinder) to ensure the synchronous movement of the ram. The standard controller of our WAD series press brake is Delem DA53T. CYBELEC and Esa brand controller can be selected based on your practical use and budget.

Common questions about heavy-duty press: Common questions about heavy-duty press brakes
Depending on tonnage and material type,: Depending on tonnage and material type, heavy-duty press brakes can bend mild steel up to 50mm thick, stainless steel up to 30mm, and aluminum up to 40mm. The exact capacity depends on the machine tonnage, working length, and material properties.
The automatic crowning system compensate: The automatic crowning system compensates for frame deflection by adjusting the table curvature. It uses CNC-controlled hydraulic or mechanical wedges to create a slight convex curve in the table, counteracting the natural bowing that occurs under heavy loads, ensuring consistent angle across the entire bend length.
Yes, heavy-duty press brakes are specifi: Yes, heavy-duty press brakes are specifically designed for continuous industrial production. They feature oversized cooling systems, industrial-grade components, and robust construction to handle 24/7 operation. Regular maintenance schedules should be followed to ensure optimal performance.
Heavy-duty press brakes require reinforc: Heavy-duty press brakes require reinforced concrete foundations due to their significant weight and operational forces. Foundation specifications vary by machine size but typically require 500-800mm thick concrete pads with proper reinforcement. We provide detailed foundation drawings with each machine.
Heavy-duty press brakes are typically cu: Heavy-duty press brakes are typically custom-engineered to specifications. Lead time ranges from 90-180 days depending on tonnage, configuration, and optional features. Rush delivery may be available for certain configurations.
We provide a comprehensive 3-year warran: We provide a comprehensive 3-year warranty on heavy-duty machines covering all major components. This includes on-site installation, commissioning, operator training, and 24/7 technical support. Extended warranty packages and preventive maintenance programs are available.
Get comprehensive technical information: Get comprehensive technical information about our heavy-duty press brake series, including tonnage charts, specifications, and application examples in PDF format.
